steps.title: I click on link "Web of Science Help" under "Help" menu

substeps.message: Appropriate multiple OA states definition ****On a results summary page, there is only a link to the best available free copy. If there is more than one free version available, links to other versions only appear in the Full Text Options menu on the record page for that article. When available, the final version of record at the publisher website is always preferred, followed by the final published version at a repository, and then by the accepted version at a repository. Links are always labeled with the version and whether they point to a publisher or repository.**** is updated in the  help file

steps.title: I check that OA Help file is updated to appropriate defintion "On a results summary page, there is only a link to the best available free copy. If there is more than one free version available, links to other versions only appear in the Full Text Options menu on the record page for that article. When available, the final version of record at the publisher website is always preferred, followed by the final published version at a repository, and then by the accepted version at a repository. Links are always labeled with the version and whether they point to a publisher or repository." for multiple OA states of OA records

steps.title: I perform search by field "Topic" with query "oil" on page "Basic Search"
I expand refine category "Open Access" on page "Result Summary"
I click on link "All Open Access padlock" under the 'Open Access' refine category
I click on link "Open Access learn More" on page "Result Summary"

substeps.message: Appropriate multiple OA states definition ****On a results summary page, there is only a link to the best available free copy. If there is more than one free version available, links to other versions only appear in the Full Text Options menu on the record page for that article. When available, the final version of record at the publisher website is always preferred, followed by the final published version at a repository, and then by the accepted version at a repository. Links are always labeled with the version and whether they point to a publisher or repository.**** is updated in the  help file

steps.title: I check that OA Help file is updated to appropriate defintion "On a results summary page, there is only a link to the best available free copy. If there is more than one free version available, links to other versions only appear in the Full Text Options menu on the record page for that article. When available, the final version of record at the publisher website is always preferred, followed by the final published version at a repository, and then by the accepted version at a repository. Links are always labeled with the version and whether they point to a publisher or repository." for multiple OA states of OA records

substeps.message: Appropriate multiple OA states definition ****A key advantage of the partnership with Impactstory is the ability to prioritize the open access links so the user sees the version of record at the publisher’s site first, followed by the final version at a repository, and then the accepted manuscript at the repository last. Only one open access link is provided.**** is updated in the  help file
